title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide both the correct choice and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

· Disagree. The density of gold is not the reason that it is a good electrical conductor. Electrical conductivity is related to the mobility of the loosely held valence electrons that surround the positive metal cores like a “sea of electrons.”

The response provides both the correct choice and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

· Disagree. The density of gold is not the reason that it is a good electrical conductor. Electrical conductivity is related to the mobility of the loosely held valence electrons that surround the positive metal cores like a “sea of electrons.”

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide both the correct choice and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

· Disagree. The photons with wavelength 130 nm MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DB1@ have a lower frequency than those with wavelength 105 nm MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DB3@ because wavelength and frequency are inversely proportional (ν= c λ ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FBD@ . Since frequency and photon energy are directly proportional (E=h ν) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4053@ , the photons with wavelength 130 nm MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DB1@ are lower in energy than those with wavelength of 105 nm MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DB3@ .

The response provides both the correct choice and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

· Disagree. The photons with wavelength 130 nm MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DB1@ have a lower frequency than those with wavelength 105 nm MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DB3@ because wavelength and frequency are inversely proportional (ν= c λ ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FBD@ . Since frequency and photon energy are directly proportional (E=h ν) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4053@ , the photons with wavelength 130 nm MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DB1@ are lower in energy than those with wavelength of 105 nm MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DB3@ .

title: Part H
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide both the correct answer and a valid explanation equivalent to one of the following.

· The solubility of XCl 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C72@ will decrease because of the presence of the common ion, Cl − (aq) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F09@ , in solution. The presence of the common ion favors a shift towards the reactants, reducing the dissolution of XCl 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C72@ .

OR

· The solubility of XCl 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C72@ will decrease because of the presence of Cl − (aq) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F09@ ions in the solution.
